intro: Thamnochortus fruticosus, commonly known as the silver leaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its evergreen nature and drought tolerance make it a hardy ornamental plant. It is often used in garden settings for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
